qas.question: What title is given to Mary in the Catholic Church?
What is the Latin word from which Mary's title of Blessed is derived?
How many Catholic dogmas are there regarding Mary?
Along with Mother of God, Immaculate Conception and Assumption of Mary, what is the other Catholic dogma related to Mary?
What title did Mary give to the Catholic Church?
Since Mary states that she is not divine, what teachings carry on her statements?
Where does Mary send prayers to?
How many Latin dogmas are there regarding Mary?
What state was Mary in before giving birth to Jesus?

context: In the Catholic Church, Mary is accorded the title "<a0_0><b4_0>Blessed<b4_0/><a0_0/>", (from Latin <a1_0>beatus<a1_0/>, blessed, via Greek μακάριος, makarios and Latin facere, make) in recognition of her assumption to <b6_0>Heaven<b6_0/> and her capacity to intercede on behalf of those who pray to her. <b5_0>Catholic teachings<b5_0/> make clear that Mary is not considered divine and prayers to her are not answered by her, they are answered by God. The <a2_0><b7_0>four<b7_0/><a2_0/> Catholic dogmas regarding Mary are: Mother of God, <a3_0><b8_0>Perpetual virginity of Mary<b8_0/><a3_0/>, Immaculate Conception (of Mary) and Assumption of Mary.
